abstract_summ: SARS-CoV-2 has been demonstrated in faeces and, in some cases, urine of infected people, as well as in wastewater . In wastewater, the resistance of SARS has proven to be very limited, especially at temperatures above 20 {degrees}C, and the virus has been easily removed with the use of chlorine (> 0.5 mg L-1 for 30 min). For sewage sludge, based on in vitro experiments, it is suggested to increase the retention times before a possible reuse in agriculture only for precautionary purposes .
